content.description: The Wandering I starts at the same place as Halftime Break and goes left along the weakest line. It follows the seam up and then trends right to follow the crack as it gets bigger.
content.protection: There is not much pro, so you either solo and use long cords to set up a toprope, as the trees and boulders are set back a bit.
content.location: Start on the rightish side of the slab - the same location as Halftime Break.

content.description: Yes, the name is meant to be tongue in cheek, but it really is a very nice slab. It is a biggest, continuous, unbroken piece of slab that I have found at The Fells. There are no holds per se - it's just trusting your feet and palming the hands. If you are in the middle the whole time, you shouldn't be able to reach the dirt of the corner on the right or the dirt on the left.
content.protection: There is a big beefy tree that can be used for anchor. Otherwise, you can just solo it (quite fun).
content.location: It ascends the slab to the left of the left-facing corner that separates the main wall from this slab. The angle is a bit shallower than the main wall.

content.description: This may be easier once the moss has been cleaned up. Start from the bottom and go straight up. It's blanker than the other two.
content.protection: There's not much pro for trad. It's mostly either solo or set up a toprope. Use long cords, as the trees/boulders are set back a bit.
content.location: On the left, there is a streak of white rock where someone has peeled the moss off for the start. Start there.

content.description: It's pretty fun. Go straight to a break/stance that forms a mini-headwall of sorts roughly 1/2 way up. Mantel up, take a break, and continue straight up to finish the route.
content.protection: Toprope or solo - the gear is marginal at best.
content.location: It is on the right-ish side of the slab.

content.description: Start on the arete, and work your way up. This is simple, but I found it pretty fun. Â I think you can squeeze in another problem by just using the right face, but it's not as fun.
content.location: From the base of the main slab, go directly north and slightly up for 15 yards. Look right from the crag, and you'll see a boulder that looks like it's perfectly cleaved (too bad it's so short). Go to it, and you'll be able to see the arete just a little further from there.

pathTokens: Quarry Road/Bellevue Pond at Middlesex Fells

content.description: There is real rope climbing in the western Fells! This is a real hidden gem with 4 good lines currently, and with some gardening and scrubbing, there should be a few more good lines. On the left, there is the best continuous easy slab at the Fells, then after a left corner, a steeper slab with 3 good routes.
